definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: I do not know you so I can not say if I have love for you in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍然素不相识，因此我还不能肯定是否真心爱你。

sentences.english: I got to ask total strangers the things I'd always wanted to know.
sentences.chinese: 我向素不相识的人们打探我一直想知道的事。

sentences.english: The Sichuan earthquake gave witness to the kindness of strangers in an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 四川大地震见证了危难中的那些素不相识者的善举。

definition: to have never met sb before (idiom); entirely unacquainted/a complete stranger/not to know sb from Adam
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
assistance/a helping hand/to lend a hand
lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
to be irrelevant/to have nothing to do with
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
to get to know each other/acquaintance
